title: Losing Hope
body: Anyone know why people lose hope so easily in LOW ELO? Most games that have 1 person being dicked by the opponent feed and then people lose hope. It's werid. Thats just early game lol. Anyone have any ideas why?

replies.body:
Same thing happens in higher elos as well. A lot of games people start saying "gg" after first blood. 

Like _He Meant Mine_ said, players have been conditioned to give up pretty early. In lower elos it's because a lot of players don't really understand the macro and micro play of the game, and really suck at playing from behind. This results in the potential for enemies to snowball out of control (you would have seen this 100x over) and the team start to tilt even harder, or start playing the blame game.

A good way to work through this is to learn as much about the ins and outs of the game so you can advise your team as you go along. Who scales better, who hits a powerspike next, and just generally being really positive and encouraging in games. Even when your teammates start tilting, doesn't mean you have to as well. By keeping a positive attitude constantly and displaying good leadership + game knowledge you will eventually get better at spreading the hype and can bring teams back from bad situations.

Or if your teammates are not the 'happy go lucky sort' just state the obvious like, 'okay we're losing teamfights but if we can kill (say) yasou we can win' or 'okay we're losing atm but at this elo either side could throw at any moment, so just hang in there and wait for them to do something dumb, we still have a decent chance at winning this'. 

I find the latter works especially well in turning around team morale if the team is very toxic, whereas the former works better if the team is friendly and well coordinated.

I would say the amount of experience people have. People who play in low elo for a long time have this sort of instinct where if something happens or its not going their way they give up.  Not many low elo people have that hope of the enemy team throwing or creating mistakes for an advantage.
